needs.description: A collection of needs that are updated and cached periodically

children.description: A collection of needs that target a specific character attribute
A collection of attribute-based needs that use custom modifiers to affect the given stat

fields.name: min
fields.description: The minimum value this need can be set through the the mod; this can be higher than the actual minimum value of the attribute

fields.name: max
fields.description: The maximum value this need can be set through the the mod; this can be lower than the actual maximum value of the attribute

children.description: Tracks the player's current attack damage bonus
Tracks the player's luck level
Tracks the player's current maximum health
A read-only need can be read by other needs, and have levels assigned to it, but cannot be changed through manipulators or level actions
Tracks the light level of the block the player's feet are in
Tracks the moon phase (0.0-1.0) of the current dimension the player is in
Tracks the saturation level of the player
Tracks the amount of natural light hitting the block the player's feet are in
Tracks the vanilla temperature based on biome and Y-level
Tracks the current Y-level of the player
Tracks the player's breath meter
Tracks the player's hunger meter
Tracks the player's current health
Used to read in scoreboard values of the given criterion; this can be specified multiple times, with different criteria for each one

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the need and the scoreboard entry; needs to be unique.

fields.name: criterion
fields.description: The scoreboard criterion; see https://minecraft.gamepedia.com/Scoreboard for valid criteria

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: The default value of the score

needs.description: A completely custom need specified by you

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the need; names should be unique

fields.name: min
fields.description: The minimum allowed value the need can reach

fields.name: max
fields.description: The maximum allowed value the need can reach

fields.name: initial
fields.description: The initial value to set the need to when a player first gets it

fields.name: resetOnDeath
fields.description: Should the need reset to the initial level upon death

mixins.description: Use this mixin to print every, single, individual, precise change to the player's chat. I don't know why you would use it, but, it's here in case u li3k ann0y1ng people.
Display a notification in chat anytime the need changes from one level to another

fields.name: actionBar
fields.description: If set to true, display this value in the action bar. If not, it will be shown in the player's chat.

mixins.description: Use this mixin to mirror the need to a scoreboard entry of the same name as the need; the value of the need will be rounded to the nearest whole number.
Adds the need to a UI display so players can easily track their current level

fields.name: displayName
fields.description: The name to display in the UI; this can be different from the need itself

fields.name: icon
fields.description: A path to an icon to use; Needs comes with a large preset amount, which can be specified with just the icon name (e.g. 'w_sword001'), or a texture from another mod by using the full path (e.g. 'minecraft:textures/item/iron_helmet')

fields.name: iconWidth
fields.description: The width of the icon texture; this defaults to 32px

fields.name: iconHeight
fields.description: The height of the icon texture; this defaults to 32px

fields.name: iconX
fields.description: If your icon path points to a texture sheet, instead of a single icon, use this to specify the X coordinate of the icon on the texture sheet.

fields.name: iconY
fields.description: If your icon path points to a texture sheet, instead of a single icon, use this to specify the Y coordinate of the icon on the texture sheet.

fields.name: iconOffsetX
fields.description: Adjust this if you want to adjust the X offset of the icon in the UI; by default, it will be (32-iconWidth)/2

fields.name: iconOffsetY
fields.description: Adjust this if you want to adjust the Y offset of the icon in the UI; by default, it will be (32-iconHeight)/2

fields.name: precision
fields.description: Sets the number of decimal places displayed in the UI; by default, this is 0

fields.name: color
fields.description: Sets the RGB color of the bar; this can either be the integer representation of the color, or you can specify a hexidecimal string starting with either # or 0x - when specifying it as hex, you may use shorthand (e.g. '#777' will expand to '#777777').

fields.name: displayFormat
fields.description: Optional expression that will be used to modify the value prior to displaying it (in case you want to multiply it, round it, square root things, etc). The min, max, value, and upper and lower bounds of the current level will all be run through this expression.

expressionVars.current: The current value of the parent need.

fields.name: downTo
fields.description: If specified, the lowest value this manipulator can set the parent need to; if set, this will incur a slight performance hit, as the value of the need has to be calculated at the manipulator level.

fields.name: upTo
fields.description: If specified, the highest value this manipulator can set the parent need to; if set, this will incur a slight performance hit, as the value of the need has to be calculated at the manipulator level.

children.description: A collection of manipulators based on damage (in or out)

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount to change by when triggered

expressionVars.current: The current value of the parent need.

fields.name: hostile
fields.description: If hostile mobs should trigger this; if inbound damage, will check the source, if outbound, will check the target

fields.name: passive
fields.description: If passive mobs should trigger this; if inbound damage, will check the source, if outbound, will check the target

fields.name: players
fields.description: If players should trigger this; if inbound damage, will check the source, if outbound, will check the target

fields.name: minAmount
fields.description: The minimum amount of damage required to trigger this

fields.name: maxAmount
fields.description: The maximum amount of damage required to trigger this

children.description: Triggered when the player attacks another entity.
Triggered when the player is healed
Called when the player is hurt

fields.name: sources
fields.description: An array of damage sources which will trigger this event.

children.description: A collection of manipulators that can display their effect in the tooltip when hovering over the item in an inventory

fields.name: showTooltip
fields.description: If true, show the tooltip. Note that doing so will incur a slight performance penalty onthe client; defaults to false

fields.name: precision
fields.description: The number of decimal places to show in tooltips; defaults to 1.

fields.name: tooltip
fields.description: If this is set, will override the value of the tooltip itself with this string.

fields.name: formatting
fields.description: A key/value map of formatting/color codes to their associated interval to format tooltips with

fields.name: displayFormat
fields.description: Optional expression that will be used to modify the value prior to displaying it (in case you want to multiply it, round it, square root things, etc). Not used if 'tooltip' is set.

expressionVars.current: The current value of the parent need.

children.description: A collection of manipulators that check blocks.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount to apply; when this is checking an area, count will refer to the number of matching blocks in the area

expressionVars.count: The count of the value being tested.
expressionVars.current: The current value of the parent need.

fields.name: blocks
fields.description: A list of blocks to check

children.description: Triggered while the player is looking at, every 5 ticks.

fields.name: distance
fields.description: The ray-traced distance to check for the block

children.description: Checks the immediate surroundings of the player for the given block(s); will fire every 5 ticks.

fields.name: radius
fields.description: The radius to check around the player; defaults to 0, which only targets the block the player is standing ontop of.

expressionVars.current: The current value of the parent need.

children.description: Triggered every 5 ticks while the player is holding the specified item

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount to change; count refers to the current stack size of the item(s)

expressionVars.count: The count of the value being tested.
expressionVars.current: The current value of the parent need.

fields.name: mainhand
fields.description: If true, check the player's mainhand for the item.

fields.name: offhand
fields.description: If true, check the player's offhand for the item

fields.name: items
fields.description: An array of items to check against, specified either as a single item (e.g. 'minecraft:cobblestone') or a tag (e.g. 'tag:minecraft:leaves')

children.description: Triggered when the player uses an item in the list

fields.name: defaultAmount
fields.description: The default amount to apply if not specified on an item level

expressionVars.saturation: The amount of saturation this grants, if food.
expressionVars.current: The current value of the parent need.
expressionVars.hunger: The amount of pips on the hunger bar this refills, if food.

fields.name: items
fields.description: An key/value map of items/amounts, or array of items using the default amount

children.description: A version of Item Used that limits the number of times the player can benefit from the effect per item

fields.name: defaultAmount
fields.description: The default amount to apply if not specified on an item level

expressionVars.saturation: The amount of saturation this grants, if food.
expressionVars.count: The number of times this item has been used prior.
expressionVars.current: The current value of the parent need.
expressionVars.hunger: The amount of pips on the hunger bar this refills, if food.

fields.name: items
fields.description: An key/value map of items/amounts, or array of items using the default amount

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique key that will be used to store data about item usage; only letters, underscores, and numbers will be recognized

fields.name: uses
fields.description: The number of times the player can benefit from the use of the item; if this is an expression, it will be rounded down to the nearest whole number.

expressionVars.current: The current value of the parent need.

fields.name: numberStored
fields.description: The number of items to remember. Items will fall off the list in order of the least recently benefited from; e.g. if uses is 2, and numberStored is also 2, then using Item A, then item B, then Item A, if you were to use Item C, then item B would fall off the list, because Item A was benefited from more recently. If this is an expression, the return value will be rounded down to the nearest whole number (e.g. 0.9 -> 0); if this is less than the size of the list at the time the list is being checked, items will automatically be dropped until the list is down to the proper size.

expressionVars.current: The current value of the parent need.

fields.name: trackDamage
fields.description: Should damage values be treated as separate items?

children.description: Triggers while the player is in one of the specified biomes/biome types; at least one or the other must be specified.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount to change by

expressionVars.current: The current value of the parent need.

fields.name: biomes
fields.description: A list of biomes that will trigger this

fields.name: biomeTypes
fields.description: A list of biome types that will trigger this

children.description: Triggered when the player dies.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount to change by.

expressionVars.current: The current value of the parent need.

children.description: Affect this need when another need has changed; do not set to the same need this is applied to. You have been warned. Can be applied multiple times to the same need with different values.

fields.name: need
fields.description: The name of the other need to check.

fields.name: minChange
fields.description: The minimum amount the other need must have changed by in order to trigger this manipulator

fields.name: maxChange
fields.description: The maximum amount the other need must have changed by in order to trigger this manipulator

fields.name: minValue
fields.description: The minimum current amount of the other need in order to trigger this manipulator

fields.name: maxValue
fields.description: The maximum current amount of the other need in order to trigger this manipulator

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount to change by when triggered

expressionVars.current: The current value of the parent need.
expressionVars.other: The current value of the other need.
expressionVars.previous: The previous value of the other need.
expressionVars.change: The amount the need changed by, or: (current - previous).

children.description: Fired every in-game hour that passes in a world after the first; will multiply its amount by the number of hours that have passed if time skips forward. May not work if time is set back.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount to set per hour

expressionVars.current: The current value of the parent need.

children.description: Triggered on tick

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount to adjust by; multiplied by the number of ticks between checks

expressionVars.current: The current value of the parent need.

children.description: This is a debug action; don't use it unless you want your console spammed.

actions.description: Adjusts the value of either the parent need, or the target need

fields.name: need
fields.description: The need to affect; leave out to specify the parent need.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount by which to change the targeted need when this action is fired; as a continuous action, it will store the amount it changes the need by, and restore it upon exiting the level.

expressionVars.current: The current value of the parent need.

actions.description: Applies a potion effect to the player

fields.name: effect
fields.description: The ID of the potion effect.

fields.name: duration
fields.description: The amount of time to apply the effect for if specified as an entry or exit action; continuous actions will ignore this.

fields.name: amplifier
fields.description: The level to amplify the potion; the default, 0, will apply as a level 1 potion, 1 would apply a level 2 potion, etc.

fields.name: persistOnDeath
fields.description: If true, the effect will be reapplied with the remaining duration on death; this only applies when this is used as an entry or exit action, continuous effects will always reapply on death.
